intro: Maieta trichotoma, commonly known as the hairy maieta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name "trichotoma," meaning "hairy." It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Maieta trichotoma is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
